revision.comment: standard quote handling in WP;standard Apostrophe/quotation marks in WP; MOS general fixes using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Other uses}} {{BLP sources|date=October 2013}} {{Infobox comedian |name = Ron White |image = Ron White01.jpg |caption = White in 2010 |birth_name = Ronald Dee White |nickname = Tater Salad |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1956|12|18}} |birth_place = [[Fritch, Texas]], [[United States|U.S.]] |active = 1987–present |medium = [[Stand-up comedy|Stand-up]] |nationality = American |genre = Country comedy, [[observational comedy]], satire, [[blue comedy]] |influences = [[Bill Hicks]], [[George Carlin]], [[Jeff Foxworthy]], [[Steve Martin]], [[Richard Pryor]], [[Sam Kinison]], [[Bob Newhart]] |website = {{url|http://www.tatersalad.com}} |footnotes = |spouse = Lori Brice (m. 1981–93)
Barbara Dobbs (m. 2004–08)
[[Margo Rey]] (m. 2013–17) |children = 1 }} '''Ronald Dee White''' (born December 18, 1956) is an American [[stand-up comedian]] and [[actor]], best known as a charter member of the [[Blue Collar Comedy Tour]]. Nicknamed "Tater Salad", he is the author of the book ''I Had the Right to Remain Silent But I Didn't Have the Ability'', which appeared on the ''[[The New York Times|New York Times]]'' best seller list. ==Biography== Ronald Dee White was born on December 18, 1956 in [[Fritch, Texas]], to Charles Don White and Barbara Joan Craig.{{cite web | title = Ron White- Profile | url = http://comedians.about.com/od/comediansmz/p/ronwhite.htm}} White served in the [[United States Navy]]. According to his own account, White joined the service at age 17 and served on the auxiliary rescue and salvage ship [[USS Conserver (ARS-39)|USS ''Conserver'']] near the end of the [[Vietnam War]].Ron White, [https://books.google.com/books?id=lr0gnS7A-PoC&pg=PT43&dq=%22ron+white%22+comedian+navy&hl=en&sa=X&ei=HiChUKXKAYaI0QH8sIG4DA&ved=0CDYQ6AEwAw#v=onepage&q&f=false I Had the Right to Remain Silent... But I Didn't Have the Ability], 2007, Chapter 3 He is an avid fisherman and has loved fishing as a hobby. From a young age his dream was to become a comedian. He lived in Mexico for a brief period and bought a pottery factory thereMark C. Anderson, [http://www.montereycountyweekly.com/news/2012/jul/26/fade-white/ Blue-collar Comedy Bad-Boy Ron White Totes Scotch and Surprising Sensitivity to Salinas] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130208132639/http://www.montereycountyweekly.com/news/2012/jul/26/fade-white/ |date=2013-02-08 }}, Monterey County Weekly, July 26, 2012 before returning to the U.S. to pursue comedy. He included stories from his youth in his book ''I Had the Right to Remain Silent But I Didn't Have the Ability''. From January 2000 through March 2003, White toured with [[Jeff Foxworthy]], [[Bill Engvall]], and [[Larry the Cable Guy]] as part of the [[Blue Collar Comedy Tour]] – a show that sold out across the [[United States]] in over 90 cities and grossed over $15 million.{{cite web | title = Ron White- Profile | url = http://comedians.about.com/od/comediansmz/p/ronwhite.htm}} He made seven guest appearances on ''[[Blue Collar TV]]''. In 2005, The [[WB Television Network]] aired the pilot for ''[[The Ron White Show]]'', a [[variety show]] that combined a number of celebrity [[cameo appearance|cameos]], [[cartoon]]s, and sketches. He taped several episodes of ''[[The Gong Show with Dave Attell]]'' as one of the celebrity judges. White has appeared in the TV shows ''[[Kath & Kim (U.S. TV series)|Kath & Kim]]'', ''[[Reno 911!]]'', ''[[12 Miles of Bad Road]]'', the films ''[[Sex and the City 2]]'' and ''[[Horrible Bosses]]'', and a cameo in a Rascal Flatts music video, "Why Wait".{{cite web | title = IMDB Ron White | url = https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1247387/}} White is known for drinking [[Scotch whisky|Scotch]] as part of his act, as well as smoking cigars or cigarettes. He stated during his ''You Can't Fix Stupid'' show, "Somebody asked what I was drinking. If the company that made the stuff I was drinking was paying me, I'd have it in their bottle and not mine. But it's the kind of scotch that people drink that are going to die penniless. It's good though!"{{cite web | title = Ron White – Scotch Whisky | url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OBakSHttTGU}} In 2009 Comedy Central released Ron's stand up DVD ''[[Behavioral Problems]]''. In 2010, Ron White and producer Michael Blakey formed Organica Music Group (OMG), a label that promotes both emerging and established musicians and comedians. OMG indicated that it would release all of White's future DVDs and CDs.{{cite web | title = Comedian Ron White and Acclaimed Music Producer Michael Blakey Partner to Form Organica Music Group | url = http://www.marketwire.com/press-release/Comedian-Ron-White-Acclaimed-Music-Producer-Michael-Blakey-Partner-Form-Organica-Music-1267639.htm}} In November 2015, White announced that he was running for [[President of the United States]] as an [[Independent politician|independent]] candidate in [[United States presidential election, 2016|2016]].[http://www.aol.com/article/2015/11/11/blue-collar-comedian-ron-white-running-for-president/21263485/ " 'Blue Collar' comedian Ron White announces he's running for president"], [[AOL News]]. November 11, 2015. Retrieved November 12, 2015. In 2016, White starred as Phil, veteran road manager for the fictional Staton-House Band, in the Showtime series ''[[Roadies (TV series)|Roadies]]''. ==Personal life== White was married to Lori Brice from 1981 to 1993 and they had one son, Marshall. He was then married to Barbara Dobbs from 2004 to 2008.http://www.nndb.com/people/735/000108411/ In October 2013 he married singer-songwriter, musician and cancer survivor [[Margo Rey]], proposing to her just weeks before her initial diagnosis. Her hairstyle, dubbed as "chemo-glam" by her husband, was cropped short for her wedding due to her chemotherapy. She continues her battle with cancer (now affecting her [[lymph node]]s), describing White as "the best husband in the world."http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20746690,00.html Rey filed for divorce in July 2017.{{cite news |url=http://amp1037.cbslocal.com/2017/07/19/blue-collar-comedian-ron-whites-wife-files-for-divorce-but-they-arent-actually-married/ |title=Blue Collar Comedian Ron White's "Wife" Files For Divorce, But They Aren't Actually Married |date=July 19, 2017 |work=Amp1037 Radio |publisher=KVIL-FM |location=Highland Park, TX |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170915204500/http://amp1037.cbslocal.com/2017/07/19/blue-collar-comedian-ron-whites-wife-files-for-divorce-but-they-arent-actually-married/ |archivedate=September 15, 2017 |df= }} On September 7, 2008, White was arrested on charges of possession of [[marijuana]] and drug paraphernalia after an anonymous tip informed [[Vero Beach, Florida]] police that White's private plane would be carrying narcotics.{{cite web | title = Comedian Ron White says disgruntled former employee tipped police off to drugs | url = http://www.tcpalm.com/news/2008/sep/15/comedian-ron-white-says-disgruntled-former-employe/}}{{cite web |url=http://www.accessatlanta.com/entertainment/content/entertainment/stories/2008/09/11/ron_white_drug_charges.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-07-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090727024406/http://www.accessatlanta.com/entertainment/content/entertainment/stories/2008/09/11/ron_white_drug_charges.html |archivedate=2009-07-27 |df= }} He was found to be in possession of 7/8 of a gram of marijuana, which White described as being "out of marijuana".http://www.tcpalm.com/news/2008/sep/10/blue-collar-comedy-tours-ron-white-arrested-vero-b/{{cite web | title = Blue Collar Comedy's Ron White Arrested in Fla. | url = http://wcbstv.com/entertainment/Ron.White.Drugs.2.815041.html}} ==Awards and recognition== April 27, 2009 was designated as "Ron White Day" in the State of [[Texas]] by Texas legislative officials.{{cite web | title= State of Texas Honors Comedian Ron White | url = http://www.stagetimemagazine.com/standup/?p=2341}} White received the [[Armed Forces Foundation]]'s "Patriot Award" in March 2009 for his work in raising money to help wounded soldiers.{{cite web | title = The Armed Forces Foundation Honors Ron White at Annual Congressional Gala | url = http://www.allbusiness.com/government/government-bodies-offices/11757732-1.html}} He also held benefit shows for [[Hurricane Katrina]] relief.{{cite web | title = Austin Hurricane Relief | url = http://www.austintexas.org/newsletter/Sept05/index.html}} White's 2013 comedy album, ''A Little Unprofessional'', was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best Comedy Album|Best Comedy Album]] in the [[56th Annual Grammy Awards]] in January 2014. ==Comedy releases== Besides the [[Blue Collar Comedy Tour]] CDs and films, White has released 6 solo projects to date. Solo Works * ''Tater Salad aka. Busted in Des Moines'' (1990) (CD) * ''[[Drunk in Public]]'' (2003) (CD) * ''They Call Me "Tater Salad"'' (2004) (DVD) * ''[[You Can't Fix Stupid]]'' (2006) (DVD & CD) * ''Behavioral Problems'' (2009) (DVD & CD) * ''A Little Unprofessional'' (2012) (DVD) He has appeared on the following compilation albums: * ''Redneck Comedy Roundup'' (2005) * ''[[Comedy Central]] Presents Southern Gents of Comedy'' (2006) * ''Ron White, [[Jeff Foxworthy]] & [[Bill Engvall]]: Live from Las Vegas'' (2004) * ''Redneck Kings of Comedy'' (2005) ==Discography== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details ! colspan="4"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2"| Certifications
([[Music recording sales certification|sales threshold]]) |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45"| [[Top Comedy Albums|US Comedy]] ! width="45"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]] ! width="45"| [[Billboard 200|US]] ! width="45"| [[Top Heatseekers|US Heat]] |- ! scope="row"| ''Tater Salad aka. Busted in Des Moines'' | * Release date: 1990 * Label: Laughing Hyena |— |— |— |— | |- ! scope="row"| ''Truckstop Comedy'' | * Release date: 1994 * Label: Laughing Hyena |— |— |— |— | |- ! scope="row"| ''[[Drunk in Public]]'' | * Release date: November 3, 2003 * Label: [[Hip-O Records]] | 2 | 11 | 83 | 2 | * [[Recording Industry Association of America|US]]: Gold |- ! scope="row"| ''[[You Can't Fix Stupid]]'' | * Release date: February 7, 2006 * Label: [[Image Entertainment]] | 1 | 2 | 14 |— | |- ! scope="row"| ''[[Behavioral Problems]]'' | * Release date: April 21, 2009 * Label: [[Capitol Records]] | 1 | 13 | 51 |— | |- ! scope="row"| ''A Little Unprofessional'' | * Release date: June 4, 2013 * Label: Organica Music Group |1 |44 |— |— |"—" denotes releases that did not chart |- |} ==References== {{reflist|refs=https://youtube.com/vZYAMFPQZ1c https://youtube.com/xsavxiFPRdk}} ==External links== {{wikiquote}} * [http://www.tatersalad.com/ Official website] * {{IMDb name|1247387}} * [http://organicamusicgroup.com/ Organica Music Group, Ron White and Michael Blakey's record label] * [http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episodes/episode_470_-_ron_white/ WTF Podcast Episode 470: Ron White] * [https://audioboom.com/posts/5853314-s02ep17-doug-stanhope-ron-white/ Radio Labyrinth 217: Ron White Doug Stanhope] {{Blue Collar Comedy}} {{United States presidential election, 2016}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:White, Ron}} [[Category:1956 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:21st-century American male actors]] [[Category:American stand-up comedians]] [[Category:American country singers]] [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:American male comedians]] [[Category:American male film actors]] [[Category:American male television actors]] [[Category:American male voice actors]] [[Category:American military personnel of the Vietnam War]] [[Category:Capitol Records artists]] [[Category:Male actors from Texas]] [[Category:People from Fritch, Texas]] [[Category:United States Navy personnel]] [[Category:United States presidential candidates, 2016]] [[Category:21st-century American politicians]] [[Category:Songwriters from Texas]] [[Category:20th-century American comedians]] [[Category:21st-century American comedians]]
